node.title: Follow Friday: People I disagree with
node.author: steevc
node.body:
There's plenty of healthy debate here on Steemit. I'm okay with people holding different opinions as long as they are open to discussing them. So, here are some people I don't always agree with, but I still choose to follow some of them: * @everittdmickey has strong view on bots and flagging on Steemit. He's very active here. * @shayne may be a bit of a Trump fan, but he's not so bad really ;) I don't buy into some of the things he posts about, but we get along. * @mindhunter has different opinions to me on various aspects of politics and finance, but he's a smart guy and one of the most active posters on Steemit. * I've known @jumowa for a few years. He thinks I'm a little naïve when it comes to trusting the news, but I think I'm less so than most people and I am open to different points of view. * @dickturpin is the only one of these I've actually met. We differ in our politics, but otherwise I think we have a lot in common. Just because you disagree with someone about some topics doesn't mean you can't be friends. We should not be afraid to admit we are wrong sometimes. Other people are using [the Follow Friday tag](https://steemit.com/trending/followfriday). We need ways to discover people to follow. Just following everyone you encounter will lead to a feed you can't keep up with. It pays to be choosy. I did the [first of these posts](https://steemit.com/steemit/@steevc/fridays-are-for-following-on-steemit) about ten months ago and I think I've done just about every week since then. Steemit is not showing all the posts when you click on the tag these days, but you can find a lot of them with the search. Steem on!

I'm Steve, the geeky guitarist.

I'll buy guitar picks for Steem Dollars

node.title: Creating The World We Long For!
node.author: teamsteem
node.body:
https://i.imgur.com/Gl2osAt.jpg 1600 - Steem's popularity is skyrocketing! Join now and profit! Seriously! And for everyone else already on Steem, let's boost this growing popularity even more. This post is about how to create the world we long for and how Steem and other cryptocurrencies can play a big part in this, why we should all try to boost Steem's growth with each of our posts as well as ways to incentivize such sharing so it becomes part of Steemians' second nature. Most people who could benefit from using Steem haven't heard about it yet and it's a no-brainer for everyone to work toward a better world helping remediate to this. ## Steem Pays Its Users! ## Steem is a revolutionary social network which pays its users for the votes, posts and comments they make depending on the votes they received. Not all votes are equal. I've made a lot of money Steeming in the last year, more than a hundred thousand dollars, but there's possibly very few people who can still expect to make many thousands solely blogging nowadays. Steem is the name of the technology and data base on which Steemit runs. Steemit is only one of the the many projects using this data base. [Busy.org](https://busy.org/) is another example, displaying the same information but differently. Steem is also the name of the currency users are being paid with. Each Steem are currently worth around [1,40$](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/steem/#markets) and can easily be exchange for money. Steem is currently distributing around 63,000 Steem daily. No credit card is required ever. The only thing needed to register is a valid email account. Steem details of its functionings can be found [here](https://steemit.com/steem/@teamsteem/steem-an-in-depth-overview). Sign up [here](https://steemit.com/pick_account). ## The Opportunity Of A Lifetime!

We're still very early and the opportunity to make interesting profits are very real. Steem currently has a bit more than 263,000 accounts. It's somewhat getting increasingly harder to succeed but any success is also increasingly more rewarding as we go. Any posts or comments can pay their authors from mere pennies to hundreds of dollars and even though the trending page is filled with posts making hundreds of dollars, no new authors should expect their posts to make this much money even though it remains a possibility. Most trending posts are from established authors holding a lot of Steem and thus having a lot to lose or gain from the Steem price performance. Also, people holding a lot of Steem are leveraging them to receive more votes and thus bigger rewards. Posting anything will get their authors some rewards, from not quite a penny to much larger rewards as mention above. Posts can be a simple link or image or more extensive post. New authors should probably stick to short posts requiring small amount of work and which are fun and witty, that is unless they know how to make their posts being paid well or if they are writing those posts with a precise objective which suits them. ## Steem Popularity Is Skyrocketing!

Steem is the most fun social network and its meteoric growth is a testament to that. Steem steemed from concept to reality in early 2016, to become the [3,673](http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/steemit.com) most visiting website today and is still going up the rank at a frantic pace. Cryptocurrencies are changing the way money is created, distributed and transacted and now Steem also change the way information is disseminated. Money "rule" the world and money creation rules money but that's a topic for another post. Every 3 seconds new Steem are created and distributed by a network of computers which no single entity control. If steemit.com were to close every Steemians would still have control of their funds and they could still access their exact same blog through other site like [busy.org](https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiE6_DriJbVAhXDuhQKHcPRCzoQFggmMAA&url=https%3A%2F%2Fbusy.org%2F&usg=AFQjCNHRaFK-QAtRGOkZjASdIcd9PQ4FoA) or app like [eSteem](https://steemit.com/esteem/@good-karma/esteem-frequently-asked-questions-faq-eys44lmimx). ## Hundreds Are Joining Everyday!

Hundreds of people are already joining Steem everyday, sometimes thousands and in a few months it could be tens of thousands. I know a lot of us wished we were making and publishing video when Youtube got launched back in early 2005. There wasn't a lot of competition back then and this would have been a good opportunity to build a valuable and fun business. The same can be said about Twitter, Facebook and Instagram. People with a lot of followers on these websites are receiving advertising offers and some of them are getting well paid to post simple advertising links. Steem present even bigger opportunities than these websites and is still in its very early days. Joining emerging social networks very early can be very rewarding and Steem is no exception. ## Our Thoughts And Actions' Purpose ##

The very purpose of our thoughts and actions should be to create the world we long for and for this to happen, it's necessary to have our ideas shared by a growing number of people, therein lies the need to share our Steem posts far and wide as much as possible. Steem and all its users will gain immensely from accelerating Steem's growth. Steem content will get much more diversify, plenty and authors will feed on each others influence of ever more enlightening reflections. The real value in each of our lives lie in the joy our actions and knowledge bring us rather than in any sorts of pseudo valuable we own, like national currencies. Cooperation amplify our joy while its opposite, abuse, leads to mutual destruction. Let's work toward greater cooperation and curtailing abuse whenever possible. Our posts should also have a place left open to introduce people to what Steem is and what it can do for them. ## Creating Beneficial Change!

As I've laid out above, reaching out to people is one of the most important thing in regard to creating the world we long for that's why I want to reward those who are doing it. My 100% upvote is worth around 70$ and I have 10 of these every 24 hours. I don't necessarily plan on giving only 100% upvote but I would love to give at least one a day for the best outreach posts. Five days ago I said I would do such a thing for introduction posts. See [here](https://steemit.com/almost-famous/@teamsteem/hello-steemit-coinmaketcap-com-introduced-me). It turned out I gave 6 100% votes in a roughly 24 hours period. Here's the [list](https://steemit.com/almost-famous/@teamsteem/hello-steemit-coinmaketcap-com-introduced-me#@teamsteem/re-teamsteem-hello-steemit-coinmaketcap-com-introduced-me-20170719t225913791z) of those posts. Any posts can be used to promote Steem, even introduction post. I will look for these posts promoting Steem in the tag #promoting-steem. None of officially listed tags on Steemit are about promoting Steem. See [here](https://steemit.com/tags). ## Creating The Culture We Long To Live From!

Let's create a culture where it's in everyone's second nature to share their most useful knowledge and human power. Sharing our posts as much as possible should be part of this. Promoting Steem can be easy and can make any already valuable posts even more valuable. It's easier to create a good post promoting Steem than to make any other type of post. ## I Made Money On Steemit And So Can You! There's so many people in dire need of money that money can always be used to attract attention but everyone should make sure to be honest though and clearly state that most people won't probably make as much money as the earliest adopters. Now no matter how much money people will make on average, Steem truly is a revolutionary technology and that's one of the reason why I want to share it far and wide as much as possible. I've already shared about all this throughout most of my posts. Here's one good [example](https://steemit.com/cooperation/@teamsteem/cooperation-is-humanity-s-greatest-asset). By the way, a click-bait title is only a click-bait if the post isn't a useful post to the person who clicked on it. A title's purpose is to have people click on it and the intent of someone clicking on a link is to have a good time seeing what's behind that link. ## Let's Reward Promoting Steem!

I will peruse the #promoting-steem tag. I invite others to join too. People should mention approximately how many people they will share their posts with, as well as provide links to these posts from their social media where they shared their posts. I use [Bitly.com](https://bitly.com/a/bitlinks) to share my links on other social networks. Bitly allow me to know how many people clicked on my links and also when. I have more than 200 clicks from Facebook's profile, on one of my [post](https://www.facebook.com/guillaumecardinalvegan/posts/10159024444040471) I shared there last week. I also have more than [90 views](https://www.facebook.com/Guillaumecardinal8/posts/1172186039593860) on the same post I share on one of my Facebook page. Steemit.com receive around [555k page views](http://www.hypestat.com/info/steemit.com) per day and around [14.4k Steem posts](https://steemdata.com/charts) are published every day. If everyone shared their posts and received only 10 clicks on them then that would result in a 25% increase in page views per day. From there, even more could be achieved. It's a given, Steem's already skyrocketing popularity would experience an epic boost if everyone would shared most of their Steem posts to their other social networks and that's why we should all make concerting efforts toward this goal. # Boosting Steemit's Already Existing Buzz!

Each and every time people will hear about Steem should help generate create more interest. Tagging friends on Facebook and Twitter as well as adding tag there, will definitely helps your posts get more views. If a lot of people begin to use the tag #promoting-steem then it might be a good idea to put the number of people the post is going to be shared with in the first line under the title's post like I did. The number of people being reached out isn't the only thing I'll be looking in rewarding posts. I'll also be looking at the overall quality. I encourage everyone to help me incentivize this habit of doing as much as possible to boost Steem's growth. Whether or not this initiative will do much difference remains to be seen. It might or might not but I felt like trying. ## Shared On ## - Facebook Profile: ([760](https://www.facebook.com/guillaumecardinalvegan)) - Facebook Page: ([204 followers](https://www.facebook.com/Guillaumecardinal8/)) - Twitter: ([600](https://twitter.com/TeamSteemLive)) - Instragram: (I'll be using it in the future) ## I'd Love To Change The World! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1URj5VJl_JE Thank you to @papa-pepper for the awesome t-shirt! ## Thank You! Thank you for reading and for commenting! I read all of them! Vote for my witness [here](https://steemit.com/~witnesses) if you consider I'm Steeming the world you want to be living in. ([What Are Steem Witnesses And Why You Should Support Them!](https://steemit.com/witness/@teamsteem/what-are-steem-witnesses-and-why-you-should-support-them)) I use [Markdown Pad](http://markdownpad.com/) to create my posts and I recommend it to everyone. See [here](https://steemit.com/steemit-help/@krnel/how-to-align-images-in-steemit-posts-left-right-and-center) how to align pictures. ### Chat Get on the chats. Not in private messages but in the chat rooms. These are some of the best places to makes some Steem friends. - [Official Steemit.chat](https://steemit.chat/) - [SteemSpeak.com](https://discord.gg/sqxV63P) (24h/7 Voice chat) - [Peace, Abundance, Liberty](https://discord.gg/6KUGbE) (Minnow Support Project) ### Find Out More! - [#1 "Stand for What Feels Best!"](https://steemit.com/joy/@teamsteem/thanks-to-steemit-i-feel-better-than-ever) (Money in the world today is created out of thin air by a small elite group at the expense of everyone else.) - [#2 "Steem: An In-Depth Overview!](https://steemit.com/steem/@teamsteem/steem-an-in-depth-overview)" (The most in-depth and clearest guide to understand what Steem is and what it can do for you!) (Reached top #1) - [#3 "The Ultimate Steem Guide!](https://steemit.com/steem/@teamsteem/the-ultimate-steem-guide)" (How to Use Steem: The revamped edition.) (Reached top #1) - [#4 "Steem: The Most Enjoyable Governance Tool Ever Devised!"](https://steemit.com/joy/@teamsteem/steem-the-most-enjoyable-governance-tool-ever-devised)(Everything we ever did was an act of governance.) - [#5 "Make More Steem: Verify Your Introduction Posts!"](https://steemit.com/introduceyourself/@teamsteem/make-more-steem-verify-your-introduction-posts) - [#6 "Some Steem Stats"](https://steemit.com/steem/@teamsteem/some-steem-stats) (The most empowering cryptocurrencies stats you'll read all day.) - [#7 "What Are Steem Witnesses And Why You Should Support Them!"](https://steemit.com/witness/@teamsteem/what-are-steem-witnesses-and-why-you-should-support-them) (The clearest guide to understand what are "Witnesses" and why you should vote for them.) - [#8 "Some Steem Tips For Some Steem Success!"](https://steemit.com/joy/@teamsteem/some-steem-tips-for-some-steem-success) (Who to follow and many more Steem fundamentals every serious Steemians should know!) - [#9 "What Will You Be Steeming When Billions Are Watching!"](https://steemit.com/joy/@teamsteem/what-will-you-be-steeming-when-billions-are-watching) (Soon millions of Steemians will be Steeming us to a much better world!) - [#10 "I Saw Your Dance Video And Now I Know You're Rich!"](https://steemit.com/joy/@teamsteem/i-saw-your-dance-video-and-now-i-know-your-rich) (Cool post pack with goodies as usual.) - [#11 "Never Lose Sight Of Why You’re Posting!"](https://steemit.com/joy/@teamsteem/never-lose-sight-of-why-you-re-posting) (Wealth is just a tool and not an end in itself. ) - [#12 "Cooperation Is Humanity's Greatest Asset!"](https://steemit.com/cooperation/@teamsteem/cooperation-is-humanity-s-greatest-asset) - [#13 "I'm Now A Full-Time Steemian!"](https://steemit.com/steemit/@teamsteem/i-m-going-to-put-my-whole-world-in-your-hands) That's it! I've quit my job. - [#14 "Steeming Never Felt This Good!"](https://steemit.com/steemit/@teamsteem/steeming-never-felt-this-good) To create the world we long to see necessitate to influence our self first and foremost. - ["#15 Hello Steemit! - Coinmarketcap.com Introduced Me!"](https://steemit.com/almost-famous/@teamsteem/hello-steemit-coinmaketcap-com-introduced-me) (This post is a template people can follow for their own introduction post. It list my most favorite short video and documentaries.) - ["Thank you Dan Larimer! You are a great mentor!"](https://steemit.com/liberty/@teamsteem/thank-you-dan-larimer-you-are-a-great-mentor) (Dan is the Ex-CTO of Steemit) - ["Steemit.com Set To Become The World's Most Popular Website"](https://steemit.com/steem/@teamsteem/steemit-com-set-to-become-the-world-s-most-popular-website) (Part of The Ultimate Steembook) - ["The most beautiful thing I’ve ever heard"](https://steemit.com/lyrics/@teamsteem/the-most-beautiful-thing-i-ve-ever-heard) (My best paid post at 8,000$)

node.title: I Held a Steemit Meetup at the Japanese Cafe Tokimeki and We Had a LOT of FUN! (Cafe Review + Meetup)
node.author: firepower
node.body:
**Three Japanese women entrepreneurs own this beautiful little cafe, "Japanese Cafe Tokimeki" in my hometown Mangalore, India. I first met them when they had a small outlet at one of the popular malls in town. Sisters Akiko Tokunaga and Yuko Tokunaga with their close friend and partner Haruka Ninomiya came to India in 2015.** 

http://i.imgur.com/MOmNqdq.jpg
<center><sup></sup></center>

They initially landed at Chennai based on the recommendation of a friend, but eventually visited Mangalore. They loved my city and decided to set up something here. 

http://i.imgur.com/cFwbPTZ.jpg

After a year of running a small unit  at the local mall, a year ago they decided to open up a proper Cafe and I've been a regular customer ever since. Overtime they became my friends and I try and support their cafe whenever I can. We're all BIG fans of Japanese anime especially Dragon Ball Z, and I also happen to like the Japanese culture very much. In fact my friends have started calling me the brand ambassador of Cafe Tokimeki! 

http://i.imgur.com/iPX9nah.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/y7ZAKn4.jpg

Recently, I was planning on a follow-up to the #1 India Steemit Accelerator and felt this was the best place for a meetup. It's small, cozy and comfy and everyone loves a good laugh here as we tend be very jovial patrons when we get together. I also felt this is a great opportunity to share some details about this wonderful cafe with our community here. 

http://i.imgur.com/YSZAXJF.jpg
<center><sup>The whole spread!</sup></center>

> Tokimeki as per my understanding means excitement in Japanese. 

The food is absolutely delicious and I've got a few photos and captions to help you understand what they were. @srinidhi managed to have a spoonful of Wasabi which blew his mind! There are some funny pictures at the end. The food got over in no time, and we pretty much emptied the stock of Maki rolls in the restaurant.

**Tokimeki is the best place to go for Japanese food in Mangalore and the next closest place is over 380 kms away in Bangalore city.** 

http://i.imgur.com/YX6xJ7W.jpg

**As you can tell in the following pictures we loved the items on the menu and we ate a LOT!** 

http://i.imgur.com/drp5dEg.jpg
<center><sup>Anko Toast - A little sweet and very delish item. Good for a quick evening snack!</sup></center>

http://i.imgur.com/gNFAUM4.jpg
<center><sup>Veg maki rolls! Authentic and tasty!</sup></center>

http://i.imgur.com/WDg62tr.jpg
<center><sup>Teriyaki Chicken Maki Rolls with hot Ginger Lemon! One of my favorite items here!</sup></center>

http://i.imgur.com/E6gsJIH.jpg
<center><sup>Full stomach makes everyone happy!</sup></center>

http://i.imgur.com/G12U0Al.jpg
<center><sup>The best French Toast you can get anywhere, served with the best Vanilla ice cream from the world famous Ideal Ice Cream parlour in Mangalore!</sup></center>

http://i.imgur.com/Y23OYzA.jpg
<center><sup>Chirashi Zushi (Scattered Sushi)</sup></center>

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=72LB2rycPaM

http://i.imgur.com/V6Sm72d.jpg
<center><sup>Maki Roll! </sup></center>

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hUwrhc8ONeY

http://i.imgur.com/6zPA0Wn.jpg
<center><sup>Blancmange - this was so incredibly good that we polished it off in seconds!</sup></center>

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KSm0YSw8BFs

<center>http://i.imgur.com/Yu0WwgJ.jpg</center>
<center><sup>French toast didnt last very long!</sup></center>

<center>http://i.imgur.com/b0gnkZ3.jpg</center>
<center><sup>Yakiniku Don</sup></center>

<center>http://i.imgur.com/sPgAelS.jpg</center>
<center><sup>Mugi Cha with salted peanuts on the side!</sup></center>

http://i.imgur.com/1Xc2ROS.jpg
<center><sup>Teriyaki chicken and mushroom!</sup></center>

You can find more photos and info on [their official FB page]
(https://www.facebook.com/cafetokimeki/).

### Steemit Meetup at Mangalore

http://i.imgur.com/w8OQD3i.jpg
<center><sup>L-R: @firepower @andreanoronha @rjsudeep @srinidhi @speedracer @neilnoronha @sanjayjkamath</sup></center>

Some of the users in the meet are doing very well after the [#1 India Steemit Accelerator was conducted](https://steemit.com/steemit/@firepower/successful-1-india-steemit-accelerator-and-steem-cryptocurrency-meetup-2017). But many were travelling at the time so only a few showed up. It was good to regroup and discuss our individual progress on the platform and I'm happy to inform that my accelerator event helped these users understand the platform better.

I also got a few ideas for the upcoming Bangalore event. It's good to see the Steemit community make a difference to the lives of many people across the world. 

### Because Meme Is Love, Meme Is Life! 

As a group of friends we are quite funny and we all love memes so @speedracer dished out a few from the event and I hope you like them! 

<center>http://i.imgur.com/oGOjVZ4.jpg</center>

http://i.imgur.com/HxlvdsN.jpg
<center><sup>Join Steemit if not the Wolverine will strike!</sup></center>

<center>http://i.imgur.com/h797Aj5.jpg</center>

<center>http://i.imgur.com/zm95L64.jpg</center>

<center>http://i.imgur.com/9g3Mhtl.jpg</center>

<center>http://i.imgur.com/cBT6f6u.jpg</center>

<center>http://i.imgur.com/NsqPZNK.jpg</center>

<center>http://i.imgur.com/JrX8g9w.jpg</center>
<center><sup>Social Media Generation be Like!</sup></center>



**If you live in Mangalore or are travelling through this city then this cafe is a must visit!** 

Until next time, Sayonara folks! 

----------
 

**If you like my work kindly resteem it to your friends. You may also continue reading my recent posts which might interest you:**
 
1. [I Donated $1300+ Of My Income Earned On Steemit Last Month and This is My Mid-2017 Donation Update!](https://steemit.com/life/@firepower/i-donated-usd1300-of-my-income-earned-on-steemit-last-month-and-this-is-my-mid-2017-donation-update)
2. [Dummies Guide to Basic Steemit Account Security + Account Recovery Guide! Must Read For Steemit Users!](https://steemit.com/steemit/@firepower/dummies-guide-to-basic-steemit-account-security-account-recovery-guide-must-read-for-steemit-users)

----------


<center>Follow Me: @firepower</center>
------------------------------------------

node.title: Security Questions at the very best
node.author: codingdefined

node.title: Interview with Exodus Wallet co-Founder Daniel Castagnoli
node.author: boxmining
node.body:
I'm interviewing the CCO of Exodus Wallet, Daniel Castagnoli and ask a few question about wallet safety and security. 

https://youtu.be/edP9fx7pBmo

https://www.exodus.io/

Questions asked:

1) Tell us about yourself and how you got into Crypto
2) Why did you make Exodus, how did you come up with the idea
3) What are a Hot Wallet and the advantages
4) What are transaction fees, and how does Exodus deal with them (is amount sent the amount we specify?)
5) What happens if there is a bitcoin chain split (are our funds safe on Exodus)
6) Why do we have to wait for wallets to refresh 
7) If we upgrade the wallet, are there any risks of losing our funds (upgrade error, lose stored data on the computer?)
8) Any Tips for Exodus Users

If you guys have additional questions, I would love to bring him back in a few months!

node.title: When Steemit.com becomes the largest crypto-exchange in the world!
node.author: fyrstikken
node.body:
Poloniex has shown themselves to be incompetent time and time again, and since Steemit.com already pay for all the traffic it receive, it only make sense to open up trading for other currencies right here on our very own Decentralized+Centralized hybrid exchange. ---
Many of us have waited for months on Poloniex to withdraw funds, apparently they were too busy trolling in the trollbox then paying attentions to tens of thousands of new users signing up every month thanks to Steemit.com. So why do we need external exchanges when Steemit.com in combination with ChainBase & the proposed Community Token DEX obviously can do a much better job. Our Systems will in the future be capable to do a whole lot more than just blogging, commenting, upvote & send funds.... Just sayin.. ---
Thanks for reading - hit me up at http://steemspeak.com for voice & text chat
---

node.title: 7 Reasons that low payout is not the reason to give up on Steemit...
node.author: hiroyamagishi
node.body:
## In a relationship, I heard it often to other people if it wasn't working, *you should quit it!* In some point, maybe they are right but probably not on Steemit. Low or No payout is not the reason to think that your effort to this community is just a waste of time.

![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmSTZfkoqWfEdyX2uT6mR3AZz2fbetbvsNoGQPYLTZ4jej/image.png)
> [image source](http://dustinmaherfitness.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/1-Dont-give-up.jpg)

# On this article, I wanna summarised to you the 7 reasons why you should stop to think about giving up on Steemit... As briefly as possible... 

## 1. Steemit wasn't a burden, it's an enjoyable thing to do with your free time and if we earned - just a bonus.

If it wasn't to Steemit I could not imagine myself writing to add values to other. I wasn't even a writer or have any experience on blogging before Steemit. Given that English is not my first language, however, I could not resist the joy and excitement whenever I see and read other peoples blog. My little innocent mind is poured in every knowledge that I have read all the time that I spent in this wonderful community. Earning is just a little bonus from the community.

http://images.clipartpanda.com/happy-computer-user-Happy-Computer.jpg
> [image source](http://images.clipartpanda.com/happy-computer-user-Happy-Computer.jpg)

## 2. Too many things to discover.

It's an awesome thing that I learned so much right from the very start when I created an account, it was like an endless learning. The more I read the more I am aware that I don't know anything. Every blog has all something in common denominator which is to add values to their readers not only that but also if you read also the comment like I always do. You will notice you gained more values that the community will benefit from it, every experience that shared of every steemians.

Every time other steemian posts about travel it feels like you're travelling too. Whenever they share the experience what it feels like to be in the classy restaurant and food looks really good it feels the same way right in very front of your computer. Good reasons that low payout doesn't stop you.

http://www.seaadventurethailand.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/Cliff-Jumping-Adventure-Main-2--1500x630.jpg
> [image source](http://www.seaadventurethailand.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/Cliff-Jumping-Adventure-Main-2--1500x630.jpg)

## 3. Gaining more experience.

I remembered a good verse in the bible that written in 1 Corinthians 10:11 ***"Now all these things happened unto them for examples:"***. Reading other person experience is a way better to learn. Like a great blog shared @lukestokes about his article [how he loss money on trading](https://steemit.com/hero/@lukestokes/i-got-margin-called-on-hero-today-things-don-t-always-go-up) being a good example to us. Other people experiences gives so much advantages even if we hardly see a dollar in our pending payouts sections.

https://legacy.hackerexperience.com/images/og.png
> [image source](https://legacy.hackerexperience.com/images/og.png)

## 4. Blogging brings you awesome memories.

Have you read the white paper on Steem? Are you aware that all we have created here on Steemit would remain in the blockchain and will not be deleted as long as internet and blockchain exist? This is the few reasons that low/no payout doesn't discourage you from creating valuable content. It creates wacky and memorable memory of you and me right on the blockchain. I feel way better on it than day trading on exchanges because it doesn't leave any mark to you and to the community, meanwhile, blogging is making yourself more valueble to others by putting your effort creating a good content.

 Imagine our great grandchild have a chance to see your article in the future because of the awesome technology we are using on Steem. They would feel very proud of you for the values and effort you have given out. Even if you didn't talk to them personally, however, on this article as if you are speaking to them, telling not to give up as well from what they persue in their life. Just what like you are showing them right now.

https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/originals/87/05/2e/87052edd3381aa570f7b2f822adda021.jpg
> [image source](https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/originals/87/05/2e/87052edd3381aa570f7b2f822adda021.jpg)

## 5. You become more adaptable to the new technology.

This thing is revolutionary but I admit it to myself even I studied computer programming still have a hard time to grasp all things we need to learn inside. But before we knew it, we become more internet player because of continues blogging and engaging with this society. We used the Markdown and HTML codes often to enhance our writing, little we know we improve a lot compared to the time we created our very first blog. Learning gives us so much that it will serve us for many years to come in which I value more than $$$.

https://www.usnews.com/dims4/USNEWS/4dc5e09/2147483647/thumbnail/970x647/quality/85/?url=%2Fcmsmedia%2F73%2Fd1c80053f197d2ba5d09881425bed4%2F42371WideModern_BusinesswomanPhone_053113.jpg
> [image source](https://www.usnews.com/dims4/USNEWS/4dc5e09/2147483647/thumbnail/970x647/quality/85/?url=%2Fcmsmedia%2F73%2Fd1c80053f197d2ba5d09881425bed4%2F42371WideModern_BusinesswomanPhone_053113.jpg)

## 6. You grow and thinking a lot in a tremendous way.

The mind is the greatest asset we had, not the stocks, nor the house, or Bitcoin. Our mind is our greatest asset of all. This tiny thing between our ears is what we need to nourish every time to create more asset. When we create a blog this little tiny thing is put to work. Like a muscle in our body, it grows bigger and bigger every time we used it. This thing can do so much, more than what we could have imagined. By blogging, we tremendously increased our mental capacity by thinking ***what is a great blog that the community will benefit more?*** By reading the blog and trying to add a valuable comment, this brain is put to work every time. 

https://mms-us.com/sites/default/files/styles/responsive/public/field/image/growth-fixed-brains-2-new.png?itok=zJgdeRd6
> [image source](https://mms-us.com/sites/default/files/styles/responsive/public/field/image/growth-fixed-brains-2-new.png?itok=zJgdeRd6)

## 7. On Steemit, the best is yet to come...

As long as we are in this awesome community, this place has so much space to grow. Did you listen to @jerrybanfield? [Steemit will possibly reach $10 per token in just 10 months or even more according to him](https://steemit.com/steemit/@jerrybanfield/10-reasons-for-usd10-steem-price-in-10-months). So many things to come especially to the upcoming Hard Fork 20 Velocity that has the plan to surpass the Reddit platform, could you imagine what would the Hard Fork 30 or Hard Fork 40 would bring to us in the near future? So many exciting things to come for us inside of the Steemit Platform. Hold on, buckle up and relax because it gonna be a bumpy ride going to Andromeda galaxy with Steem! Steem on!

https://media.giphy.com/media/kjjRGpezebjaw/giphy.gif

## Thank you sharing your precious time with me...

![20187124_1397259430311761_1149177159_o.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmSbkpJKGi3Tgct75tC6unLuygvSCgaj3AFRkk8q6EMMfp/20187124_1397259430311761_1149177159_o.jpg)

# <center> *Please **upvote, resteem and follow me,** thank you.*
https://steemitimages.com/0x0/http://i.imgur.com/IldZ0Oz.png
https://steemitimages.com/0x0/http://i.imgur.com/YZlXigd.png
https://s19.postimg.org/hrgljfa7n/image.png
[![alt text](https://img1.steemit.com/0x0/http://i.imgsafe.org/dd8bd8753d.gif)](https://steemit.com/@hiroyamagishi)</center>

node.title: SIBCOIN: Since triggering the dMAmapping⇗⇗⇗⇗⇗⇗ BUY Alert Signal on 19th December 2016 at $0.07966, SIBCOIN has exploded in growth to $1.84..!!
node.author: stephenkendal
node.body:
SIBCOIN PRICE CHART

![SIBCOIN.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmTSPnYwU5ZJQTCJVg1dsh5ngQ6yykZeVsDxzAdYmnaptc/SIBCOIN.png) ![SIBCOIN dMAs screen.png](https://steemitimages.com/DQmTTF2cVqGyD8antmNRZLrid8kYvuVqE4tqJiRvg5w427h/SIBCOIN%20dMAs%20screen.png)

dMAmapping⇗⇗⇗⇗⇗⇗ Screen

SIBCOIN triggered a dMAmapping⇗⇗⇗⇗⇗⇗ BUY Alert Signal on 19th December 2016 at $0.07966 and has since seen an explosive Growth of no less than x 23.10 to the current price of $1.84. With a current Market Capital of approx. $28m and Ranked No.69 in the Crypto Currency Market, SIBCOIN has witnessed an explosive rise in these last 7 months. Currently we have a BULLISH recommendation on SIBCOIN and will be monitoring the technicals over the next few weeks. Thanks again for reading. Stephen

node.title: STEEM at .96 Cents / SBD at .86 Cents - Bitcoin loosing $1,300 in 3 weeks.  Trading at $1,913 - What a DROP
node.author: crowe
node.body: Steem and the SBD loosing half of their value in 3 weeks time.  OUCH.  Looking for a massive spike up soon.  Bitcoin also has been smashed.  Bitcoin currently at $1913 and change.  A drop of $1,100 in 3 weeks.   OUCH.  Keep holding people.  Crypto's will be going up soon.  I've noticed that Crypto currencies like to ride up and down big waves.  Just look at how a roller coaster gains speed to move back up the high tracks.  First the Coaster must go down at a steep incline, and then it races back up quickly.  No worries folks.  Crypto's are now about to race up.  Cheers. https://steemitimages.com/0x0/https://steemitimages.com/DQmQ9aiLDBdTds4QPeiBPcHDfpCAmMKAawUBAbxoEu32k31/IMG_0403.JPG
